definition: sound/noise/note (of musical scale)/tone/news/syllable/reading (phonetic value of a character)
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]

sentences.english: This paper focuses on the different formations of the disyllabic words in You Ming Lu, an anthology in Nan dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 南朝小說《幽明錄》的複音詞有多種構詞方式。

sentences.english: Secondly: We will thoroughly depict the structure of The History of Southern Dynasties' polysyllabic words.
sentences.chinese: 第二章是對《南史》複音詞的結構進行細緻的描寫。

sentences.english: Jinwen "Shangshu" is in the important stage which evolves from monosyllabic words to polysyllabic words.
sentences.chinese: 今文《尚書》正處於單音詞向複音詞演變的重要階段。

sentences.english: But as for the internal structure of various types of words, they are much more complex than polysyllabic words.
sentences.chinese: 但具體到各詞類的內部結構，卻又比複音詞複雜得多。

sentences.english: The study of compounds is one of the important subjects in research of the Chinese vocabulary.
sentences.chinese: 複音詞研究是漢語詞彙研究的重要課題之一。

sentences.english: Many scholars have paid wide attention on the disyllabic and polysyllabic words of the pre-Qin period.
sentences.chinese: 先秦時期的複音詞研究已經引起了學者廣泛的重視。
